title.narrative: The Young Women for Awareness, Agency, Advocacy and Accountability (YW4A) Programme

description.narrative: Strengthening the advocacy capacity of 27 women’s rights organizations (WROs) to amplify young women’s voices in Palestine, Egypt, Kenya, and South Sudan by 2025. 2. Enhancing the leadership of 17,540 young women to effectively engage in collective action and decision-making in public, private, and civic spaces in Palestine, Egypt, Kenya, and South Sudan by 2025. 3. Transforming social norms and practices of 22 faith-based organizations (FBOs) that constrain young women’s rights in Palestine, Egypt, Kenya, and South Sudan by 2025. 4. Influence the adoption, amendment, withdrawal or effective utilisation and implementation of 18 laws and policies towards promoting young women’s rights to leadership, participation and ending SGBV in Palestine, Egypt, Kenya and South Sudan by 2025.

The programme aims to strengthen and diversify young women’s participation and amplify their voices to effectively influence decision-making towards gender-just laws, policies, norms, and practices related to their bodily integrity and equal participation.

participating-org.narrative: Young Women's Christian Association of Kenya

name.narrative: Meru County, Kisii County, Migori County

title.narrative: IO1 Enhanced capacity of 16-28 WROs to amplify young women's voices

description.narrative: For IO1 the programme envisages amplifying young women’s voices by promoting that WROs provide space in their internal organisations for young women and establish internal inclusive processes and practices in decision-making, management, and programming. Also, by working with WROs to include, represent, hear, mentor, support, and prepare young women to take part in advocacy initiatives, link them to strategic decision-making forums, and scale-up local advocacy strategies.

title.narrative: Number of capacity building activities (per type of activity) that have enhanced WROs capacity to advance women’s rights and gender equality

description.narrative: AK 1.1.1.2 AOCA Webinar, AK 1.1.1.2 AOCA WRO Inception Meeting, AK 1.1.1 2 AOCA results workshops, AK 1.1.1.2 AOCA collective WRO workshop, AK 1.4.1.2 Safe and dialogue spaces for the identification of national advocacy priorities (1.4.1.2) ; AK 1.1.1.1 Country inception meeting; AK 1.1.1.1 County Inception Meetings,AK1113 General advocacy training AK114 Legal advocacy training AK1313 Broadening the YW4A-WRO movement through interaction with the SOAWR platform

title.narrative: Number of young women participating in the capacity building activities
# young women, with 60 % from marginalised communities, assuming leadership roles in public and civic decision-making at community level (disaggregated by cohort).

description.narrative: This indicator refers to the number of young women who are trained TOT and who experience changes in leadership skills, experiences and practices. Leadership roles are measured by capacity to apply different forms of leadership training (to peers), willingness to become role models, self-confidence and efficacy, planning and facilitation skills, public speaking, advocacy, willingness to engage in policy change and with actors in public and civic decision-making spaces, exercise of leadership roles in the community, women’s groups, CSOs and political spaces, mobilization of young women, networking.

title.narrative: # of young women who have gained awareness of their rights, deepened their understanding of women's rights issues, and the ability to generate support around a common cause.competencies towards private and public leadership and advocacy along peers

description.narrative: 300 young women have gained awareness of their rights, deeper understanding of women rights issues, and ability to generate support around a common cause

title.narrative: Number of capacity building activities (per type of activity) that have strengthened individual agency, leadership competencies towards private and public leadership and advocacy.

comment.narrative: AK 2.1.1.2 Local adaptation of the YWCA Rise Up! training format and content development, Training of baseline data collectors, Capacity assessment of young women in Cohort 1, AK 2.1.1.1 Data collection workshops, Participatory data analysis workshop, AK2.1.1.3/ AK 2.2.1.4, AK 2.2.1.2 Training of cohort one using RiseUp! Leadership model, life skills training, consultations and identification of advocacy priorities using World YWCA Feminist Consultation Methodology, AK 2.1.1.4 Safe spaces and empowering dialogues same as AK1.4.1.2 Safe and dialogue spaces for the identification of national advocacy priorities.

title.narrative: IO 4a Key laws and policies are adopted, amended, or repealed towards promoting young women’s rights to leadership, participation and ending SGBV, and are effectively implemented.

description.narrative: Under intermediate outcome (IO) 4, also referred to as Pathway 4, the Young Women for Awareness, Agency, Advocacy and Accountability (YW4A) programme aims to influence the adoption, amendment, withdrawal or effective utilisation and implementation of laws and policies towards promoting young women’s rights to leadership, participation and ending SGBV in Palestine, Egypt, Kenya and South Sudan by 2025

title.narrative: Number of capacity building activities (per type of activity) that have enhanced WRO and Young Women's advocacy capacity tat the national and regional level

description.narrative: AK4.1.1.2 Capacity strengthening on the legal landscape AK 4.1.2.2 Media advocacy training for WROs
